content.question: Which of the following is true of the marginal revenue curve for a monopolistically competitive firm?

choices.label: It is the same as the demand curve because there are many firms in the market.
It is the same as the demand curve because marginal revenue is always equal to price.
It is upward sloping because total revenue increases as the quantity sold increases.
It lies below the demand curve because the firm must lower its price for all units in order to increase sales.
It lies below the demand curve because marginal revenue increases when price decreases.

content.answer: It lies below the demand curve because the firm must lower its price for all units in order to increase sales.
